definition: open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
lumpy/rock pile/uneven/fig. sincere/open and honest
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Do you think that politician is on the up-and-up?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得那位政客的所作所爲是否光明磊落？

sentences.english: The man had a keen sense of justice and fair play.
sentences.chinese: 此人具有強烈的正義感，做事光明磊落。

sentences.english: Open and aboveboard in their minds that he and the daughter of a deep love of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 表明他光明磊落的心跡和對典獄長女兒深深眷戀。

sentences.english: A hero is the man who is above aboard.
Second, open and aboveboard, do not harm the interests of the original units.
sentences.chinese: 光明磊落，不要損害原單位的利益。

sentences.english: The people I respect are straightforward ones; the ones I hate are snobs.
sentences.chinese: 我崇敬的是光明磊落的人，痛恨的是勢利小人。

sentences.english: Keep are upright, aboveboard, take the way to success.
sentences.chinese: 守正不阿，光明磊落，取之以道，追求成功。

sentences.english: His part in the affair was quite( open and) aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 在這事情上，他的行爲是非常光明磊落的。

sentences.english: I'm not threatening, just giving you fair warning.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經光明磊落地對待你，給你公平合理的警告。

sentences.english: Everything he did was always quiteaboveboard.
Their actions are open and aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 他們的行爲都是公開及光明磊落。
這些商業交易是光明磊落的。

sentences.english: I have dealt fairly with you, and have given you fair warning.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經光明磊落地對待你，給你公平合理的警告。

sentences.english: His part in the affair was quite aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 在這事情上，他的行爲是非常光明磊落的。

definition: big and stout/big-hearted/open and honest/continuous/repeated
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous/openhearted/unselfish/magnanimous/broad-minded
daring to act and courageous enough to take responsibility for it/a true man has the courage to accept the consequences of his actions/the buck stops here
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to distinguish right from wrong (idiom)
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
magnanimous/broad and level
displaying strength and discipline/impressive/upright and frank/square
selfless/impartial
upright and plainspoken
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
upright
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
The honest person does nothing underhand (idiom)./fig. Do what you want to do openly and without dissimulation.
pinyin: ming2 ren2 bu4 zuo4 an4 shi4

definition: upright gentleman/man of honor
to hate evil as one hates an enemy (idiom)
